org.numenta.nupic.util

Interface SparseMatrix<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Superinterfaces:
    FlatMatrix<T>, Matrix<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix, AbstractSparseMatrix, FastConnectionsMatrix, LowMemorySparseBinaryMatrix, SetSparseMatrix, SparseBinaryMatrix, SparseObjectMatrix

    public interface SparseMatrix<T>
extends FlatMatrix<T>
    Allows storage of array data in sparse form, meaning that the indexes of the data stored are maintained while empty indexes are not. This allows savings in memory and computational efficiency because iterative algorithms need only query indexes containing valid data. The dimensions of matrix defined at construction time and immutable - matrix fixed size data structure.
    Author:
    David Ray, Jose Luis Martin

      Uses the specified TypeFactory to return an array filled with the specified object type, according this SparseMatrix's configured dimensions
      int[] get1DIndexes()
      Returns an array of all the flat indexes that can be computed from the current configuration.
      int[] getSparseIndices()
      Returns a sorted array of occupied indexes.
